actor

Class Hobbit

  • java.lang.Object
    • actor.Actor
      • actor.Hobbit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Hobbit
extends Actor
    The Hobbit class is a subclass of Actor. The Actor class tracks state information for individual actors in the simulation: name, health, strength, speed, etc (and later, a screen avatar with coordinates). Additional attributes are tracked in the subclasses. The behaviours (moving and battling) are defined in the subclasses. The Actor class is abstract, thus no Actor objects will ever be created -- only subclass objects, such as Hobbit. The Hobbit class adds characteristics that are unique to elves.
    Version:
    Lab Assignment 4: The Hobbit Battlefield Simulator
    Author:
    Rex Woollard
    See Also:
    Actor, ActorFactory, Army, Serialized Form

      static double MAX_STEALTH
      100.0
      static double MIN_STEALTH
      0.0
      private javafx.beans.property.SimpleDoubleProperty stealth
      Influences the visibility of this object; sufficiently high stealth means Hobbit object cannot be seen by others.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        overrides the superclass (Actor) version of toString() and provides a textual representation of the Hobbit object. It calls upon the Actor to assemble its toString components, then adds the Hobbit-specific details.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Actor

      • createAvatar

        public void createAvatar()
        Each subclass of Actor MUST define its own unique avatar, which can be ANY kind of Node. It MUST because the method createAvatar() is defined as an abstract method. The Hobbit creates a Circle object.
        Specified by:
        createAvatar in class Actor

      • getAvatar

        public javafx.scene.Node getAvatar()
        Even though avatar is defined as a Circle (in the Hobbit class), it is returned as a reference-to-Node, to simplify use of the avatar object elsewhere in the program.
        Specified by:
        getAvatar in class Actor
